summary:
My research concerns citizen science, volunteering and participation, especially around topics of nature, environment and landscape. I aim to bring the perspectives of (active) citizens into focus, especially their motivations and experiences.

My PhD research drew on quantitative methods to investigate the profile, motivations and experiences of Dutch green volunteers, and as a postdoc I carried out qualitative research into the potential of ornithological citizen science to foster environmental citizenship. My current work addresses participation and justice in the energy and climate transition.

profile_positions.description: As a postdoc I contribute to further developing the Academic Collaborative Center Climate & Energy. At the department of Public Law & Governance I am involved in research on participation and the role of citizens in the climate and energy transition.
profile_positions.title: Postdoc Researcher

profile_positions.description:
In my postdoc research I carried out qualitative research into the potential of ornithological citizen science to foster environmental citizenship. Within the H2020 project EnviroCitizen we studied this in birding (birdwatching and bird ringing) through history and in present volunteer activities, and designed interventions to strengthen it in the future.

Since 08/2020 I co-organised the weekly colloquium series. I was also the institute's data manager (since 02/2021), and from september 2021 I joined the faculty Gender and Diversity Committee
profile_positions.title: Postdoc Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My PhD research concerned the human-nature relationship, especially among nature-oriented citizen scientists and other green volunteers. Using quantitative methods, I brought their perspectives into focus, especially their motivations and experiences.

I studied the motivations and experiences of Dutch green volunteers within a project funded by the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature and Food Quality, and I carried out survey research among the participants of the Dutch National Bee Survey.

I also represented ISiS in PROBE, the faculty-wide PhD council, for over two years (12/2017 - 03/2020)
profile_positions.title: PhD Student

profile_positions.description:
- At the Institute for Science in Society (ISiS) I carried out research into motivations of voluntary biodiversity recorders, and I was involved in researching public landscape perceptions within the NWO-TTW project RiverCare

- At the department of Geography, Planning and Environment (GPE) I assisted in the EU FP7 project STAR-FLOOD, a comparative research project into the governance of flood risk in six European countries
profile_positions.title: Junior Researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: Every other week, I help set up the Pink Lunch for LGBT youth at the RU and HAN
Als penningmeester was ik verantwoordelijk voor de financiële administratie, en ondersteunde ik de initiatieven van deze LHBT+ jongerenstichting d.m.v. fondsenwerving en subsidieaanvragen
